channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Greenland's leader says "we are not for sale" after Trump suggests U.S. takeover
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump also seemed to suggest the Panama Canal should belong to the United States.

item.title: Many Americans have come to rely on Chinese-made drones. Now lawmakers want to ban them
Luigi Mangione pleads not guilty to state murder, terrorism charges
item.description: Luigi Mangione pleaded not guilty Monday to state charges in the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson.

item.title: 'We are not California': New Jersey dealers push back on electric truck rules

item.title: For young adults, caregiving isn't just hard. It can shape you for life

item.title: How hopes for Myanmar's democracy faded and why leadership is needed (again)
item.description: Former U.S. Ambassador to Myanmar Derek Mitchell asks how hopes for Myanmar's democracy faded and why leadership is needed again in restoring them.

item.title: 6 key takeaways from the Matt Gaetz ethics report

item.title: Man arrested over death of woman set on fire on New York subway
item.description: The woman fatally set alight on a Brooklyn train was attacked by a man she is not believed to have known.

item.title: Biden commutes 37 federal death row sentences. And, a push to understand long COVID

item.title: Kremlin denies reports Assad's wife has filed for divorce
item.description: Following reports in Turkish media, a Kremlin spokesman denies Asma al-Assad wants to divorce her husband and leave Russia.

item.title: Mauritius hints Chagos talks stuck over money
item.description: The deputy PM said the UK was "quibbling" over the sum to be handed over to Mauritius.

item.title: Children among dozens killed in Israeli strikes, Gaza officials say
item.description: A school sheltering displaced families was hit, according to Gaza's civil defence agency.

item.description: Walmart and Branch Messenger, a payments platform, accused of deceiving workers about pay from retailer for two years.
